page.title: 09 POUND FARMHOUSE
page.content: Pound Farmhouse is no longer a working farm.Its land was sold to a neighbouring farm by 1927. The house was built in the 1500s. It is a timber framed building with lath and plaster between the beams. In the middle ages lost animals were brought here to graze and drink from the pond, that is how the house got its name Pound Farmhouse. Rayne mill used to stand by the river close to Pound Farmhouse. The mill was built in the 1700s and was mostly used as a grain mill. But in the early 1900s the river dried up so it was no longer used. It was pulled down in 1908. Mrs Sweetenham now lives at Pound Farmhouse with her husband. They have lived there for 16 years. They have a big garden with a pond and a paddock across the road.
